review: Though I find it to be very useful. The iOS 8 updates have hindered the Wi-Fi data performance. It takes forever to stream an HD movie purchased from my library. Sometimes tells me that it will take 17-21 hours for my movie to be ready. Only seems to be immediate when plugged in directly into the modem.This is my second Apple TV that I purchased. For years, I've used it only on Wi-Fi. I had an internet package that gave me up to 50mbps with old router. I have since upgraded to a 125mbps package with an extremely high caliber dual band router that provides coverage for up to 10,000 sq.ft. The Apple TV does work well being 7 feet from the router. It is not the equipment. I noticed the change shortly after the iOS upgrade on both my Apple TVs. Went to war with my internet provider and upgraded everything. But still didn't solve the problem.Since I've gotten Chromecast, use a Nexus 6, HTC One Max and LG G2 on the network and get download speeds between 80-100mbps. Streams like a champ! Except for my Apple TVs. Very upset! I have thousands of dollars in movies that I cannot watch because there is no something wrong with Wi-Fi connectivity. Same movies will stream on my iPad with with no problem.
author: Joseph Woolridge
